metadata.title: CVE-2019-13767 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in media picker in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.88allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
